xxl.core.indexStructures

Class QueryCursor

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor
      • xxl.core.indexStructures.QueryCursor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterator, Cursor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BPlusTree.QueryCursor, MVBTree.MVBTreeQueryCursor, VariableLengthBPlusTree.QueryCursor

    public abstract class QueryCursor
extends AbstractCursor
    This class represents lazy Cursors which can be used to perform queries on a Tree. For example see BPlusTree.QueryCursor.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Tree.Node currentNode
      The current Node in which the query is at the moment executed.
      protected Tree.IndexEntry indexEntry
      The IndexEntry refering to the current Node.
      protected Stack path
      A Stack to hold the path from the root to the current Node.
      protected Descriptor queryRegion
      A Descriptor which specifies the query.
      protected int targetLevel
      The target level of the query.
      protected Tree tree
      The Tree in which the query has to be executed.

      • Fields inherited from class xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor

        assignedNext, computedHasNext, hasNext, isClosed, isOpened, isValid, next

      In the default implementation it returns true.

      Replaces the last element returned by the method next() by the given data object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QueryCursor

        public QueryCursor(Tree tree,
                   Tree.IndexEntry subRootEntry,
                   Descriptor queryRegion,
                   int targetLevel)
        Creates a new QueryCursor.
        Parameters:
        tree - the Tree in which the query has to be executed
        subRootEntry - the IndexEntry which is the root of the subtree in which the query has to be exectuted
        queryRegion - a Descriptor which specifies the query
        targetLevel - the target level of the query

    • Method Detail

      • supportsRemove

        public boolean supportsRemove()
        In the default implementation it returns true.
        Specified by:
        supportsRemove in interface Cursor
        Overrides:
        supportsRemove in class AbstractCursor

        In the default implementation it returns true.

        Returns:
        true
        See Also:

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Removes from the underlying Tree the last element returned by the method next(). The default implementation is equivalent to: 
        
                                        super.remove();
                                        removeObject();
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Iterator
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Cursor
        Overrides:
        remove in class AbstractCursor

      • update

        public void update(Object data)
        Replaces the last element returned by the method next() by the given data object. The default implementation is equivalent to: 
        
                                        super.update(data);
                                        updateObject(data);
        Specified by:
        update in interface Cursor
        Overrides:
        update in class AbstractCursor
        Parameters:
        data - the object replacing the last object returned by next()

      • abolishPath

        protected void abolishPath()
        It is used to empty the path.

      • path

        public Stack path()
        Gives the current path.
        Returns:
        the current path

      • hasPath

        protected boolean hasPath()
        Checks whether the path to the current Node exists.
        Returns:
        false if path is null and true otherwise.

      • removeObject

        protected abstract void removeObject()
        This method is called from the method remove() and takes over the real work to remove an element from the QueryCursor. The user has to implement it so that it makes sense in the respective Tree.

      • updateObject

        protected abstract void updateObject(Object data)
        This method is called from the method update(Object) and takes over the real work to update an element from the QueryCursor. The user has to implement it so that it makes sense in the respective Tree.
        Parameters:
        data - the new object by which the old object has to be replaced
